Detailed Description

A quadtree node The only node you have to create is the root node The difference with other nodes is that the root has no parent To build the root node only the 3 first parameters are required (and the second and third are optionnal)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

§ Quadtree()

ltbl::priv::Quadtree::Quadtree ( const sf::FloatRect &  region,
unsigned int  maxOccupants = 5,
unsigned int  maxLevels = 5,
Quadtree *  parent = nullptr,
unsigned int  level = 0,
unsigned int  type = 0 
)

Constructor.

Parameters
regionThe region of the quadtree
maxOccupantsThe number of occupants per region, having more occupants will make the quadtree split
maxLevelsThe number of depth level of the quadtree, if this level is reached, the quadtree will never split again
parentThe parent of this quadtree
levelThe level of this quadtree
typeThe type of this quadtree, used to render the quadtree
